frameDefinitions: In this frame, a Booker brings about a situation where an Organization plans to provide Services to a Client at a particular Scheduled_time.
In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
A Customer requests an Entity from a Supplier.
A Defendant is tried by a Jury or Judge in a Court for Charges.

This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.  '' 'Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 bail until June 18.'
These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.
frameExamples: We can <t>book</t> you a boatride on the Somme or a special tour of the Louvre .
I <t>ordered</t> a black scarf from J. Crew a week ago.
The state will <t>try</t> him for fraud.
Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 <t>bail</t> until June 18.
Abby bought a car from Robin for $5,000.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that is intended to receive the <fen>Services</fen> of the <fen>Organization</fen>.
The goods or labor that the <fen>Client</fen> requests the <fen>Organization</fen> preserve for future consumption or rendering.
The entity that enters into its records the request of the <fen>Client</fen> to retain <fen>Services</fen> in the future.
The future point in time when the <fen>Client</fen> arranges for the <fen>Organization</fen> to provide <fen>Services</fen>.
The entity that contacts the <fen>Organization</fen> directly.  In many if not most cases, a <fen>Booker</fen> is also a <fen>Client</fen>, but the roles may also be separated, e.g. a travel agent.
The time at which the reserving event takes place.
The location the <fen>Booker</fen> performs the action.
The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
The <fen>Customer</fen> is the person or business ordering the <fen>Entity</fen> from the <fen>Supplier</fen>.
The object ordered by the <fen>Customer</fen>.
The person or organization from whom the <fen>Customer</fen> orders the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Customer</fen> requested the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Judge</fen> heads the <fen>Court</fen> where the case is tried.  An expression referring to the <fen>Court</fen> may also stand in for the <fen>Judge</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is being tried for the <fen>Charges</fen> in <fen>Court</fen>.

This role identifies the people who are charged by the <fen>Court</fen> to listen to the testimony, evidence, and arguments, and come to a consensus about the guilt or innocence of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Charges</fen> brought against the <fen>Defendant</fen>.
The <fen>Defendant</fen> is tried under the laws of the <fen>Governing_authority</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the case is tried.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the case is tried.
At the time of bail setting, the <fen>Accused</fen> is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court  a specific amount of money for bail.
The <fen>Judge</fen>, as head of  the Court, determines the <fen>Accused</fen>'s bail.
<fen>Status</fen> idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are 'without bail/bond', 'on one's own recognizance', or a specific amount of money required for bail.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bail setting occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bail setting occurs.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: Phil Collins booked his <fex>cockatoo</fex> into a $350-a-night pet hotel.
She reserved the room for the meeting <fex>for Tuesday</fex> .
The hotel reserved two rooms for me .
I booked the room for Monday <fex>only on Tuesday</fex> .
<fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
<fex>'I'd like an extension,'</fex> begged Pat.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
I urged him to concede <fex>yesterday</fex>.
<fex>Simone</fex> ordered a hamburger and fries.
Liz ordered <fex>a new espresso maker</fex> for the office.
Mrs. Apfelbaum ordered a coffee <fex>from the barista</fex>.
Sara placed the order <fex>three days ago</fex>.
<fex>Judge Murphy</fex> will try the defendant for murder.
<fex>The United States</fex> will try the accused bomber in a federal courthouse.
Judge Duncan fixed <fex>the doctor's</fex> bail at one million dollars.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> fixed the doctor's bail at one million dollars.
Judge Duncan fixed the doctor's bail <fex>at one million dollars</fex>.
<fex>Jess</fex> bought a coat.
Only one winner purchased <fex>the paintings</fex>

sourceCandidateSpans.text: as late as the end of the year
